title: Codegen: classes (struct/impl/new)
description: Compile user-defined Haxe classes to Rust: emit struct for instance fields and impl block for methods + constructor (new).
acceptance_criteria: Generated Rust for a simple class compiles with cargo build.
close_reason: Emitted user classes as Rust struct + impl with constructor (new) and instance methods using HxRef.

title: Local issue
description: desc

title: Demo 1 — ratatui todo TUI (scripted + interactive)
description: Build a deterministic (CI-friendly) ratatui-based todo TUI demo written mostly in Haxe, to dogfood the Rust target and exercise arrays/loops/enums/switch.

title: Compiler: Array<T> → Vec<T> support
description: Add core compiler support for Haxe Array<T> mapping to Rust Vec<T> (type mapping, literals, indexing, length).

title: Compiler: loops (while/for)
description: Add compiler support for while/for loops and any required Rust AST statement forms so generated code is valid Rust.

title: Demo: Haxe-driven todo state + ratatui renderer
description: Rewrite examples/tui_todo to be a real todo app: Haxe owns the todo state + action loop; Rust module renders frames using ratatui TestBackend. Keep deterministic output for CI.

title: Tests: stdout snapshot support
description: Extend test/run-snapshots.sh to optionally run cargo run -q and compare stdout when intended/stdout.txt exists.

title: Rust AST: struct/impl + printer
description: Extend RustAST + RustASTPrinter to represent/print Rust struct items and impl blocks (incl. methods).
acceptance_criteria: Rust output renders a struct + impl with a simple method and cargo fmt check passes on generated code.
close_reason: Implemented RustAST struct/impl nodes + RustASTPrinter support.

title: Roadmap: reflaxe.rust milestones (0–10)
description:
Tracks the milestone plan from `prd.md` (section 8).

Scope: Haxe 4.3.7 → Rust target built on Reflaxe with an AST-first pipeline (Builder → Transformer → Printer) and a Rust runtime crate (hxrt).

Primary outputs: haxelib + generated Cargo project (portable mode default; rust-native mode opt-in).

title: Milestone 0 — Project skeleton + compiler registration
description:
Deliverables:
- `haxelib.json`, `extraParams.hxml`
- `CompilerBootstrap.Start()` and `CompilerInit.Start()`
- `RustCompiler` registered via `ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler(...)`
- `RustInjection.__rust__` macro shim
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe build with `-lib reflaxe.rust` and `-D rust_output=out` triggers the compiler
- Output directory receives at least one generated file (stub is OK)
close_reason: Milestone 0 complete: haxelib skeleton + bootstrap/init registration + __rust__ shim + stub output.

title: Scaffold haxelib layout + build entrypoints
description:
- Create initial directory layout (`src/`, `std/`, `runtime/` placeholders)
- Add `haxelib.json` + `extraParams.hxml` to auto-register macros
- Ensure `-lib reflaxe.rust` loads correctly
close_reason: Scaffolded haxelib (haxelib.json + extraParams.hxml), vendored reflaxe, added examples + runtime placeholder.

title: Implement CompilerBootstrap.Start (classpath + gating)
description:
- Inject target classpaths early (`std/`, target src)
- Gate activation via `Context.defined("rust_output")` (and/or target.name==rust)
close_reason: Added CompilerBootstrap.Start() to inject vendored reflaxe + std/ only when -D rust_output (or target.name==rust).

title: Implement CompilerInit.Start (compiler registration)
description:
- Register `RustCompiler` via `ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler(...)`
- Configure output extension `.rs`, output dir define `rust_output`, `__rust__` injection name
close_reason: Implemented CompilerInit.Start(): registers RustCompiler via ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler and wires rust_output + __rust__ injection.

title: Add RustInjection.__rust__ macro shim
description:
- Provide `reflaxe.rust.macros.RustInjection.__rust__(code,args)`
- Emit `macro untyped __rust__($a{...})` so typing succeeds; codegen handles later
close_reason: Added reflaxe.rust.macros.RustInjection.__rust__ macro shim (untyped __rust__ call for Reflaxe injection).

title: Emit stub output so rust_output gets files
description:
- Minimal OutputIterator path that writes at least one `.rs` file into `-D rust_output` dir
- OK to be a hardcoded stub initially (proves plumbing)
close_reason: Compiler now emits a minimal Cargo project (Cargo.toml + src/main.rs) into -D rust_output.

title: Milestone 9 — Rust-native API layer (crate interop + ergonomics)
description:
Deliverables:
- Cargo dependency registry + `Cargo.toml` generation
- `rust.*` externs + helper macros
- Improved `__rust__` injection (prefer AST emission when possible)
acceptance_criteria: - Example project declares `serde` dep and uses derive/injection to serialize successfully

title: Milestone 10 — Performance + idiomatic mode optimizations
description:
Deliverables:
- Optional `-D rust_native` / `-D rust_idiomatic` mode
- Arrays → `Vec<T>` when semantics allow
- Reduce clones in hot paths
- Better loop lowering to iterators
- Optional `rustfmt` integration (`-D rustfmt`)
- Compilation output determinism guarantees
acceptance_criteria:
- Benchmarks show measurable improvements on representative workloads
- Output stays readable and stable across runs

title: Milestone 1 — Rust AST + printer + OutputIterator hello world
description:
Deliverables:
- Minimal `RustAST` node set
- `RustASTPrinter` with deterministic formatting
- `RustOutputIterator` that prints AST to `.rs`
- Generate minimal Cargo project (`Cargo.toml`, `src/main.rs` or `src/lib.rs`)
acceptance_criteria:
- Compiles a trivial `Main.main()` that does `trace("hi")`
- `cargo build` succeeds for generated project
- Running the binary prints sensible output (trace may be stubbed to `println!`)
close_reason: Milestone 1 complete: Rust AST + transformer+printer + output iterator; emits Cargo.toml + src/main.rs; smoke compiled/runs.

title: Define minimal RustAST node set
description:
- Add core nodes for items, stmts, exprs, and types needed for hello-world
- Keep representation small; extend only as codegen needs grow
close_reason: Added minimal Rust AST types in src/reflaxe/rust/ast/RustAST.hx (functions, stmts, exprs, types).

title: Implement RustASTPrinter (deterministic formatting)
description:
- Print a minimal module with functions/blocks/exprs
- Ensure output is stable across runs (ordering, whitespace)
close_reason: Implemented deterministic Rust printer in src/reflaxe/rust/ast/RustASTPrinter.hx (rustfmt-clean for snapshots).

title: Implement RustOutputIterator (Cargo project + .rs files)
description:
- Write per-module `.rs` output
- Generate `Cargo.toml` + entrypoint (`src/main.rs` or `src/lib.rs`)
- Wire module tree (`mod.rs`/`pub mod`) as needed
close_reason: Implemented RustOutputIterator + extra Cargo.toml emission (BaseCompiler.setExtraFile) and main.rs routing to rust_output/src/main.rs.

title: End-to-end hello-world compile + cargo build smoke
description:
- Compile a trivial Haxe `Main.main()` that uses `trace("hi")`
- Ensure generated project `cargo build` succeeds and runs
close_reason: Verified end-to-end: examples/hello compiles to Cargo project and  prints output.

title: Milestone 2 — Typed expression coverage (core subset)
description:
Deliverables (compileExpression coverage):
- constants: null/int/float/bool/string
- locals, vars, let-binding
- calls, method calls
- blocks
- if/else
- return
- basic binops: + - * / == != < <= > >= && ||
- unary ops: ! -
- simple field access (no inheritance yet)
acceptance_criteria:
- Snapshot tests compile and produce rustfmt-clean output for:
  - arithmetic
  - string concatenation
  - if/else branching
  - local variables and assignments
close_reason: Milestone 2 complete: core expression subset + snapshot harness.

title: Expressions: literals + locals + assignments
description:
- Emit RustAST for null/int/float/bool/string
- Support local var decls, reads, and basic assignment
close_reason: Implemented literals/locals/var decls/assignment compilation in RustCompiler (TConst/TLocal/TVar/OpAssign).

title: Expressions: unary + binary ops
description:
- Implement `!` and unary `-`
- Implement core binops: + - * /, comparisons, &&/||
- Decide and document string concatenation strategy (portable mode first)
close_reason: Implemented unary/binary ops (+,-,*,/, comparisons, &&/||, !, -) + string concat lowering to format!("{}{}").

title: Control flow: blocks, if/else, return
description:
- Compile blocks as Rust `{ ... }`
- Lower if/else expressions/statements correctly
- Handle returns (unit vs value)
close_reason: Implemented blocks (tail expr), if/else, and return lowering in RustCompiler.

title: Calls: function calls, method calls, simple field access
description:
- Support calls and method calls for simple cases
- Support instance field access (no inheritance yet)
close_reason: Implemented TCall/TField lowering incl. haxe.Log.trace -> println!, static/instance field access, and same-class static calls.

title: Snapshot test harness for generated Rust
description:
- Add a minimal snapshot structure (`test/snapshot/<case>/...`)
- Harness compiles Haxe → Rust and diffs output
- Optional: run rustfmt in CI-like mode when available
close_reason: Added snapshot harness (test/run-snapshots.sh) with cases covering arithmetic, string concat, if/else, return; outputs rustfmt-clean.

title: Milestone 3 — Data model: classes, fields, constructors, methods
description:
Deliverables:
- `ClassBuilder` emits `struct` + `impl` methods + constructor (`new`)
- Portable allocation strategy: `Rc<RefCell<T>>` (via runtime alias like `HxRef<T>`)
- Field reads/writes use short borrow scopes
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe class with fields + methods compiles and runs correctly
- No borrow-checker errors in generated Rust for simple usage patterns
close_reason: Milestone 3 complete: structs/impls + HxRef instance model + class snapshot/example.

title: Milestone 4 — Enums + switch → match
description:
Deliverables:
- `EnumBuilder` emits Rust `enum` variants (tuple variants for args)
- `SwitchBuilder` lowering:
  - enum switch → `match`
  - int/string switch → `match`
  - fallback to if-chain when patterns don't map cleanly
acceptance_criteria:
- Typical Haxe enum ADT example compiles
- Generated Rust uses `match` idiomatically for enum switching

title: Enums: emit Rust enums (variants + tuple args)
description: Add Rust enum codegen: Rust AST item for enums + printer support + compileEnumImpl emits Rust enum variants (including tuple variants).

title: Switch: lower switch to match (with fallback)
description: Implement TSwitch lowering to Rust match for enums + int/string switches; fall back to if/else chain when patterns are unsupported.

title: Enums: compile enum values + patterns
description: Support enum constructor expressions (Action::Up, Action::With(x)) and make them usable in arrays, equality, and switch patterns.

title: Snapshots: enums + switch
description: Add snapshot coverage for enums and switch lowering (Rust match output, buildable and rustfmt-clean).

title: Milestone 5 — Interfaces + inheritance (portable semantics first)
description:
Deliverables:
- Traits for interfaces and base-class polymorphism
- Trait impls for `RefCell<Concrete>`
- Accessors for polymorphic field/property access
- Basic RTTI: stable type ids + `__hx_type_id()`
acceptance_criteria:
- Base-typed variable calling overridden method dispatches correctly
- Interface-typed variable works
- Simple `Std.isOfType` works (even partial)

title: Interfaces: trait emission + type mapping
description: Emit Rust traits for Haxe interfaces, map interface types to Rc<dyn Trait>, and generate impls for implementors.

title: Inheritance: base traits + dynamic dispatch
description: Generate base-class polymorphism traits and compile base-typed calls to dynamic dispatch (overrides).

title: Polymorphic field accessors
description: When a receiver is interface/base-typed, compile field reads/writes via generated get/set accessors on the trait.

title: RTTI: __hx_type_id() + minimal isOfType hook
description: Add stable per-class type ids and expose __hx_type_id() on polymorphic traits; (stretch) compile class refs to ids for a minimal Std.isOfType.

title: Snapshots: interfaces + inheritance
description: Add snapshot cases proving interface-typed and base-typed dynamic dispatch works.

title: Milestone 6 — Exceptions and try/catch
description:
Deliverables:
- `hxrt::exception` with thread-local payload + panic id mechanism
- Codegen for `throw`
- `try/catch` lowering via `catch_unwind` helper
acceptance_criteria:
- Example that throws/catches values behaves as expected
- Nested try/catch works

title: Milestone 7 — Haxe stdlib Tier 1 support
description:
Tier 1 targets:
- `Std` (stringify/parse/isOfType stub)
- `Type` (typeof/enum helpers/getClassName minimal)
- `Reflect` (field get/set minimal)
- `haxe.ds.Option`, `haxe.functional.Result` idiomatic mapping
- `haxe.io.Bytes` backed by `Vec<u8>`
- Iterators needed for `for` loops

Deliverables:
- Minimal `std/` overrides where needed
- `hxrt` modules backing these APIs
acceptance_criteria: - Snapshot suite of stdlib-focused examples compiles and runs

title: Milestone 8 — sys package and IO
description:
Deliverables:
- Support core `sys.*` via Rust `std`:
  - `sys.io.File`, `sys.io.FileInput`/`FileOutput`
  - `sys.FileSystem`, `Sys`
acceptance_criteria:
- Read/write file example works
- Directory listing works
- Basic CLI args and exit codes work

title: Roadmap — v1.0: Rusty profile + idiomatic polish + lix
description:
Track the remaining work to reach a solid v1.0 of reflaxe.rust. Focus areas:

1) Rusty profile: opt-in mode that feels closer to Rust idioms and ecosystem types (owned containers, Option/Result, borrow-scoped APIs).
2) Idiomatic output polish: reduce noise in generated Rust (parens, unreachable arms, naming/warnings) without breaking Haxe semantics.
3) Tooling: lix-based dev workflow (pin Haxe) + CI alignment; GitHub-only releases for now.
acceptance_criteria: - Beads has a set of child epics/tasks that cover Rusty profile + idiomatic output + lix tooling.\n- Each child epic has clear acceptance criteria and snapshot coverage where relevant.

title: Rusty profile — owned Rust types + borrow-scoped APIs
description: Implement the third profile (reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty) aimed at users who want Haxe syntax but closer-to-Rust idioms. Provide explicit rust.* APIs (Vec/Option/Result/HashMap) that map to std Rust types in generated code, plus borrow-scoped (closure-based) helpers so apps do not need raw __rust__.
acceptance_criteria:
- reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty has behavior differences vs idiomatic.
- std/rust exposes a minimal, documented rust.* API surface (Vec/Option/Result at least).
- Snapshot tests cover core rust.* usage patterns and compile+build cleanly.

title: Rusty profile: define API + ownership/borrow rules
description: Write a short design doc that defines what reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty means (vs portable/idiomatic), what guarantees it does/does not provide, and the initial rust.* API surface (Vec/Option/Result/HashMap). Include how borrow-scoped helpers work and what is considered "framework" vs "app" code (no raw __rust__ in apps).
acceptance_criteria:
- A doc exists in-repo describing the rusty profile and the initial rust.* APIs.
- The doc includes examples (Haxe code) and the expected generated Rust patterns.
- The doc defines what borrow-scoped helpers prevent/allow.

title: Rusty profile: rust.Vec<T> (std wrapper + compiler mapping)
description: Add a rust.Vec<T> type in std/rust that maps to Rust std::vec::Vec<T> in generated code under rusty profile. Provide core API: new(), fromArray(Array<T>), toArray(), len(), push(), pop(), get(), set(), iter(). Ensure no app-level __rust__ usage (wrap in std if needed).
acceptance_criteria:
- A new std/rust Vec API exists and compiles.
- Under reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty, rust.Vec<T> is emitted as Vec<T> (no hxrt container).
- Snapshots cover push/pop/index/iteration patterns.

title: Rusty profile: rust.Option<T> + rust.Result<T,E>
description: Add rust.Option<T> and rust.Result<T,E> types in std/rust that map to Rust Option<T> and Result<T,E> in generated code under rusty profile. Provide minimal ergonomic helpers (some/none, ok/err, isSome/isNone, unwrap/expect, map, and match helpers where feasible).
acceptance_criteria:
- rust.Option and rust.Result exist under std/rust.
- Under reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty they map to Option/Result in emitted Rust.
- Snapshots cover creation, branching (match/switch), and simple map usage.

title: Rusty profile: borrow-scoped helpers (withRef/withMut)
description: Add closure-scoped borrow helpers in std/rust (e.g. rust.Borrow.withRef / withMut) that let users safely borrow a value for a scope and prevent borrow leakage in generated Rust. First target: containers like rust.Vec and maps like rust.HashMap. Prefer zero-cost borrows in emitted Rust (use &T / &mut T), and keep the API Haxe-friendly.
acceptance_criteria:
- Borrow helpers exist and are documented with examples.
- Generated Rust uses &/&mut borrows with a tight scope.
- At least one snapshot demonstrates borrow helpers avoiding borrow-checker conflicts.

title: Rusty profile: snapshots + demo coverage
description: Add snapshot test cases that compile with reflaxe_rust_profile=rusty and exercise rust.Vec / rust.Option / rust.Result basics. Optionally add a small example (non-TUI) that uses the rusty APIs without __rust__.
acceptance_criteria:
- New snapshot cases exist and pass in CI.
- At least one case compiles with rusty profile and runs deterministically (stdout snapshot if applicable).

title: Rusty profile: rust.HashMap<K,V>
description: Add a rust.HashMap<K,V> type (std/rust) mapping to std::collections::HashMap<K,V> in generated code under rusty profile, with minimal API: new(), get(), insert(), remove(), containsKey(), keys()/values()/iter().
acceptance_criteria:
- rust.HashMap exists and maps to std::collections::HashMap in Rust output.
- Snapshots cover basic insert/get/remove patterns.

title: Idiomatic output — cleanup + naming strategy
description: Improve readability and reduce Rust warnings in generated output (especially under reflaxe_rust_profile=idiomatic and =rusty). Focus on expression parentheses, match exhaustiveness, mut inference, and a coherent naming strategy (snake_case without collisions or broken reflection).
acceptance_criteria:
- Expression printer uses precedence-aware formatting (no blanket parentheses).
- Match generation avoids unreachable wildcard arms when exhaustive.
- A documented plan exists for snake_case naming (with collision rules) and at least one part is implemented.

title: Idiomatic output: precedence-aware expression printing
description: Replace blanket parentheses around unary/binary/cast expressions with precedence-aware printing in RustASTPrinter. Goal: eliminate rustc warnings like unused_parens and improve readability without changing semantics.
acceptance_criteria:
- Generated code no longer wraps every binary/unary/cast in parens.
- Snapshot suite updated and still passes (cargo fmt + build).
- At least the known warnings (unused_parens in while/index) are resolved.

title: Idiomatic output: remove unreachable match wildcard arms
description: When generating Rust match expressions, avoid emitting `_ => {}` if the match is already exhaustive (common for enums where we emit all variants). This removes rustc unreachable_patterns warnings and makes output cleaner.
acceptance_criteria:
- Generated enum matches do not include an unreachable wildcard arm.
- Snapshot(s) updated (tui_todo is a known case) and cargo build emits fewer warnings.

title: Idiomatic output: RustNaming module + collision rules
description: Create a centralized RustNaming helper (like reflaxe.elixir’s naming modules) for snake_case conversion, reserved keyword escaping, and collision avoidance. Document the rules (what happens if two identifiers map to the same snake_case). Start applying it to at least one category (e.g., generated module names and synthetic temporaries) as a first step.
acceptance_criteria:
- RustNaming exists with tests or snapshots proving deterministic behavior.
- Collision handling is defined and deterministic.
- At least one part of codegen uses RustNaming instead of ad-hoc string munging.

title: Idiomatic output: broaden mut inference + reduce warnings
description: Extend mutability inference (let vs let mut) to catch more mutation patterns (compound assigns, mutation through certain method calls, etc.) and reduce unused_mut warnings. Keep behavior strictly opt-in to idiomatic/rusty profiles.
acceptance_criteria:
- Idiomatic/rusty profiles produce fewer unused_mut warnings in snapshots/examples.
- No regressions in correctness (snapshots still pass).

title: Tooling — lix workflow + GitHub-only releases
description: Align dev and CI tooling with lix (like haxe.elixir.codex). Add npm+lix setup so the repo can be built/tested with a pinned Haxe, and keep releases GitHub-only for now (no haxelib publish step).
acceptance_criteria:
- Repo supports `npm install` + `npx lix download` for a pinned Haxe toolchain.
- Snapshot harness prefers local lix haxe when present.
- CI uses the same approach or remains compatible, and release workflow is GitHub-only.

title: Tooling: add npm+lix dev setup
description: Add a minimal package.json (like haxe.elixir.codex) with lix as a dev dependency and scripts to download a pinned Haxe toolchain. Update README with lix-first instructions (./node_modules/.bin/haxe) while keeping haxelib dev workable.
acceptance_criteria:
- package.json exists with lix devDependency and postinstall runs lix download.
- README documents lix workflow for this repo.
- Existing snapshot harness still works locally/CI.

title: Tooling: snapshot harness prefers lix haxe when present
description: Update test/run-snapshots.sh to prefer a project-local Haxe binary (./node_modules/.bin/haxe) when available, falling back to system haxe. This matches reflaxe.elixir.codex and makes CI/local consistent.
acceptance_criteria:
- run-snapshots.sh uses local haxe if present.
- CI still passes.

title: Tooling: CI uses lix; releases GitHub-only
description: Adjust .github/workflows to follow the lix workflow (npm ci + lix download) or at least be compatible with it. Remove/disable haxelib publishing; keep GitHub release asset packaging.
acceptance_criteria:
- CI installs Haxe via lix (or clearly prefers it) and runs snapshots/examples.
- release.yml publishes a GitHub Release asset without trying to submit to haxelib.

title: v1 Hardening: Hygiene + Runtime Parity + Security
description: Milestone plan after Rusty v1.0: reduce warnings/rough edges, expand rusty runtime/stdlib surfaces, and add CI security guardrails (secret scanning etc).

title: Compiler hygiene: warnings + output polish
description: Reduce compiler-generated Rust warnings and improve output ergonomics. Focus on unused imports/aliases, unused mut, and per-module import hygiene.

title: Use type-usage to avoid unused imports
description: Use Reflaxe TypeUsageTracker (BaseCompiler.getTypeUsage()) to emit only required  lines and  alias per module. Goal: eliminate / warnings caused by unconditional headers.

title: Reduce unused mut in idiomatic output
description: Improve mutability inference so idiomatic builds avoid  warnings (locals, temporaries, constructor self_, common patterns).

title: Portable style warnings policy
description: Portable profile keeps Haxe names; add crate/module-level  etc (or a toggle) so portable builds don't spam style warnings.

title: Optional deny-warnings mode
description: Add  to emit  (or equivalent) so CI/users can enforce warning-free output when desired.

title: Rusty runtime + stdlib parity
description: Expand the rust.* surface and runtime abstractions so developers can write Rust-idiomatic Haxe without raw __rust__ in apps. Iterate toward 1.0 feature completeness.

title: Rusty string surface (Str/String)
description: Design + implement rusty-friendly string APIs: likely  (borrowed) + helpers to avoid excessive clones, while keeping portable semantics safe.

title: Rusty slices + iterators
description: Introduce rust.Slice<T>/rust.Iter<T> (or similar) and compiler mappings so rusty code can be iterator-first without raw Rust injection.

title: Rusty path/fs/time primitives
description: Add rust.* bindings for PathBuf/OsString/Duration/Instant and minimal tools for common CLI apps.

title: Rusty error model helpers
description: Improve Result/Option ergonomics (macros/tools), consider mapping common Haxe errors to Result in rusty profile without breaking portable exceptions.

title: CI security guardrails
description: Add CI checks to prevent secret leaks and improve supply-chain hygiene.

title: CI: gitleaks secret scanning
description: Add secret scanning to CI to detect leaked credentials/tokens in git history and PRs.

title: CI: dependency review
description: Add GitHub dependency-review-action to flag suspicious dependency changes on PRs.

title: CI: CodeQL analysis
description: Add GitHub CodeQL workflow to scan Rust + JS/TS.

title: Milestone 10: performance + ownership ergonomics
description: Push reflaxe.rust toward v1 by reducing clone noise, improving loop lowering/iteration ergonomics, and tightening borrow/move behavior without breaking portable semantics.

title: Reduce clone-heavy match lowering
description: Reduce or eliminate unnecessary clones in enum/Option/Result match lowering (especially when the matched value is consumed or can be matched by reference). Goal: fewer Clone bounds and more idiomatic Rust (match-by-move where safe).

title: Rusty iteration ergonomics (Vec/Slice)
description: Make common Rusty containers usable in Haxe for-loops (for (x in ...)) without manual toArray calls. Options: compiler-special-case lowering, or iterator adapters that don’t leak __rust__ into apps. Must preserve Haxe semantics (no accidental moves).

title: Reduce String/Array cloning hot paths
description: Audit and reduce avoidable clones in generated Rust (Strings, Arrays/Vec) while preserving Haxe semantics. Prefer borrow-based or move-based lowering when safe; add snapshot coverage for non-Clone types where applicable.

title: Lowering: class instances (HxRef field/method)
description: Lower new/field access/method calls for class instances using portable HxRef (Rc<RefCell<T>>) and short borrow scopes.
acceptance_criteria: No borrow-checker errors for simple field reads/writes and method calls.
close_reason: Lowered new/field access/method calls for class instances using HxRef + borrow-safe assignment blocks.

title: Tests: class snapshot + example
description: Add a snapshot test + example project that compiles and runs a Haxe class with fields + methods.
acceptance_criteria: Snapshot compiles, rustfmt check passes, and cargo run prints expected output.
close_reason: Added class snapshot + example; snapshots compile, rustfmt clean, and cargo run produces expected output.
